results.title: The Making of 'Orchestra!': Piano. The conductor
results.creator_credit: Declan Lowney, Jonathan Lewes and Initial (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Orchestra!”.
This volume of the “Orchestra!” series explores the making of the series. It examines the role of the piano as a solo instrument within an orchestra and the role of the conductor from learning the score through interpretation, the metronome and rehearsal technique.

results.title: Opus: impressions of British art and culture
results.creator_credit: Don Levy, James Archibald and British Information Services
results.brief_description: An impressionistic survey of the arts in Britain ranging from sculptors and painters at work to a display of Mary Quant fashions and vistas of modern architecture. The theatre is represented by excerpts from three plays staged by the Royal Shakespeare Company and there is a sequence from a new ballet by Sir Frederick Ashton. Some of the work of Henry Moore is seen as well as paintings by Francis Bacon. Includes a brief appearance by a very young Googie Withers.

results.title: Options
results.creator_credit: Howard Sturges, Jerry Aronson and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: Believing that people want to feel, hear and become involved in art, the Chicago Museum of Contemporary Art, and its sister museums created “Options” - an exhibit meant to be touched and played with. It is a new approach to contemporary museums, involving more than just passive looking. The roving camera explores the reactions of the participants, and through the use of fast cuts, unusual angles and electronic music, the film becomes as involving an experience as the exhibit itself. Narrated by Ken Nordine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Howard Sturges, Jerry Aronson and Perspective Films

results.title: Darrow = Clarence Darrow: attorney for the damned
results.creator_credit: Richard Heus, Stephen Stept, John David Coles, Heus-Stept Productions and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description: Born in 1857 in Ohio, Clarence Darrow was to become one of the most famous and highly recognised lawyers in America, most notably through the defence of Eugene Debs during the Pullman railroad strike (1894), the Nathan Leopold and Richard Loeb murder trial (1924) and the John Scopes “Monkey trial” (1925). He was a defender and a champion of the poor, an intellect, and a paradox, leaving his successful country practice in Ohio to become a Chicago based lawyer where he entertained and became the darling of the young intellectuals, his Chicago apartment the site for frequent gatherings. In 1907 Darrow successfully defended Bill Haywood and other leaders of the Western Federation of Miners, accused in the bombing-assassination of the former governor of Idaho but in Los Angeles in 1912, it was Darrow himself who was on trial, charged with an attempted bribe of a juror. This made-for-television biographical dramatization of Darrow’s life provides an insight into this brilliant, somewhat unorthodox, lawyer who relied upon the power of the spoken word. Starring Kevin Spacey as Clarence Darrow, with Erin Cressida Wilson, Rebecca Jenkins, Chris Cooper, Paul Klementowicz, Calista Flockhart.

results.title: Operavox
results.creator_credit: Barry Purves, Gary Hurst, Graham Ralph, Mario Cavalli, Natalia Dabizha, Valeri Oganov, Glenn C. Holberton, John Cary, Naomi Jones, Renat Zinnurov, Sue Goffe, Bare Boards Production, BBC-TV, BBC Enterprises, Christmas Film, Pizzaz Pictures and Sianel 4 Cymru (S4C) (Channel 4 Wales)
results.brief_description: This television series from the United Kingdom combines traditional opera with various animation techniques. Contains six segments from the operas: Carmen, Barber of Seville, Turandot, Magic Flute, Rigoletto, Das Rheingold. Traditional puppet animation (by Natalia Dabizha) is used for the Barber of Seville (Rossini) applying a suitably comic tone to the excerpt. Mario Cavalli utilises live action footage, and then paints over the images for his animated segment from Carmen (Bizet). For Rigoletto (Verdi) the dark themes of the opera are ably evoked with stop action puppet animation by Barry J.C. Purves. Other animators include: Gary Hurst (Puccini’s Turandot), Valeri Oganov (Mozart’s The Magic Flute), and Graham Ralph (Wagner’s Das Rheingold). The musical performance is by the Welsh National Opera and features various singers in each segment. Barber of Seville: Donald Maxwell, Peter Bronder, Patricia Bardon (singers), Gareth Jones (conductor) ; Das Rheingold: Phillip Joll, Penelope Walker, Janice Watson (singers), David Seaman (conductor) ; Carmen: Jean Rigby, Adrian Thompson, Donald Maxwell (singers), Julian Smith (conductor) ; Turandot: Jane Eaglen, Edmund Barham, Janet Watson (singers), Wyn Davies (conductor) ; Rigletto: Jonathan Summers, Rosemary Joshua, Anthony Mee (singers), Wyn Davis (musical director) ; The Magic flute: Neill Archer, Alwyn Mellor, John Connell (singers), David Seaman (conductor). Some images of nudity and violence make this DVD unsuitable for young children.

results.title: Operation skilltest
results.creator_credit: Robert Walker, Peter Johnson, Australia. Army. Director of Army Recruiting and Film Australia
results.brief_description: An army recruiting film showing something of the training for over 500 separate skills necessary to keep the Australian Army at peak efficiency and flexibility including truck driving, parachute packing and boat skills.

results.title: Operation G.A.T.E.
results.creator_credit: Don Virgo, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film tells the fascinating story of one project in the long-range Global Atmospheric Research Program (GARP) intended to extend the time, the range and the accuracy of weather forecasting. The film centers on the activities of the sophisticated Canadian weather ship Quadra, anchored some 3000 kilometers off the west coast of Africa during Operation GATE (the GARP Atlantic Tropical Experiment), the largest international weather study ever undertaken. Elsewhere in the world, the film examines the activities of land, aircraft and satellite weather stations.

results.title: Open window
results.creator_credit: Richard Patterson, American Film Institute and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Based on a story by Saki. Frampton Nuttle is a nervous, irresolute character. He retreats from closing a draughty window when Vera appears, twitches and trembles as she tells of the death of uncles, and retreats at the sight of these supposedly dead men suddenly arriving through open windows. Cast includes Britt Leach, Cindy Eilbacher, Mary Wicks, Roslie Williams, Alan Caillou, William Beckley. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Operation Barbarossa
results.creator_credit: Peter Batty and Peter Batty Productions
results.brief_description: It was the biggest, bloodiest, bitterest battle ever fought. It cost the lives of at least 20 million people and ended Europe’s dominance in world affairs. It was the head-on clash of the two mightiest armies Man has ever known - and in sheer numbers, miles of front, and quantity of guns and shells and tanks, no other battle in history can compare with it. Unique archival material is combined with notable contributions from some of the participants, such as Albert Speer to document Hitler’s doomed attempt to subdue Russia.
